movie_title: Los Angeles protests: Trump sends marines: BBC Learning English from the News
introduction: Donald Trump sends the Marines to Los Angeles after immigration raids lead to protest  üîéFor a free

vocabulary.definition: a restriction where people are banned from being outside in a particular place at a particular time
vocabulary.example: The curfew meant that everyone had to be home by 8 o'clock.

vocabulary.definition: to stop or calm, often used in law enforcement to mean stop unrest, a riot, or a rebellion
vocabulary.example: The police managed to quell the trouble quickly.

vocabulary.definition: a situation caused by predicting that it will happen, where talking or thinking about something makes it happen
vocabulary.example: She thought she would fail her driving test, so she didn't prepare. It was a self-fulfilling prophecy when she failed.

vocabulary.definition: to move troops or equipment into position for military action
vocabulary.example: US Marines were deployed to Los Angeles to help quell anti-ICE riots.

vocabulary.definition: a state of dissatisfaction, disturbance, and agitation in a society
vocabulary.example: The city was in a state of unrest following the immigration raids.

vocabulary.definition: to stimulate or incite (someone) to do or feel something, especially by deliberate actions
vocabulary.example: Sending military presence to the city could provoke further violence.
